review: What are you waiting for? This is a must have media player for your TV if you don't have SmartTV built in. For $35, the price is unbelievable cheap for the content you receive. This thing is a lot cheaper than Roku or Amazon Fire. If you want to just watch youtube or Netflix, this will work perfectly fine.  Setup is also very easy and you won't have an extra player setup underneath the TV. Overall, I highly recommend the Chromecast and is a must have as long your TV supports HDMI.
author: George Hanks

As far as quality goes, it seems rather sound, and if your wireless router/access point is either N or AC, you shouldn't have an issue delivering HD content to it from your devices.

review: I recently got a Chromecast for Christmas (2013). I hooked it up to an older Panasonic Plasma in the bedroom that didn't have the smart TV apps. I immediately fell in love. This tiny little gadget breathed new life into my old TV.But it wasn't until I started using Plex media server, that it really started to shine. Chromecast + Plex Media server will out preform any smart TV on the marked. I loved it so much I bought a 2nd Chromecast for my new LG TV that even had all of the smart TV stuff.The other Chromecast apps are nice too (Netflix, HBO Go), as well as just tab casting. I've never experienced any of the lag that some other reviews mention.
author: Dave
